website_summaries.verdict: You won't find better full-sized wireless headphones for under $50 than the Tribit XFree Tune.
pros: The Tribit XFree Tune sounds terrific for the money
It's comfortable to wear and seems relatively well built
The headphones fold up to fit into an optional carrying case and battery life is rated at a healthy 24 hours at moderate volume levels
cons: The carrying case boosts the price by $5
The Tribit logo could be less prominent
Amazon product page touts noise-canceling technology but it's only for voice calls, not true active noise-canceling

customer_reviews.title: The sounds amazing
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for wireless over the ear headphones and all the quality ones were well over $100 dollars. I watched a review by CNET rating the top 2019 wireless over the ear headphones. Of course all of them were the high end headphones $200+. The reviewer did a special mention of the Tribit Xfree and praised it for its quality of sound and stated it could compete with high end models. Needless to say they do perform as well as the high end models for a fraction of the cost. The sound really is amazing. I highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: alw1031

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working. Need to find out how to get a replacement or to get a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: MRT

customer_reviews.title: three
customer_reviews.text: Awesome headphone balances bass and treble .nice ear cushion.BUT it finally broke after 1 year of use bought jan 2018 to dec 2018...do know we could get a refund or warranty for this .
customer_reviews.author: Regi Mathew

customer_reviews.title: A must buy
customer_reviews.text: This headphones deliver an incredible value for the money. I cannot believe still how good they are compared to similar product but much more expensive from big brands. I paid about 60 usd delivered all the way to New Zealand (got here in 4 days).
customer_reviews.author: Fabio Santoro / Samantha Long

customer_reviews.title: Tribit HPs stopped working
customer_reviews.text: After a three months of very light use, my Tribit HPs stopped working. They show that apparently they have a charge. However, they won't turn on, no matter what I do. Amazon says that my window for support expired on January 9. I was under the impression that they came with an 18-month limited warranty. Any help will be appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Carballido

customer_reviews.title: Soft earpads, quality and fashion looklike, really fast connection with iphone
customer_reviews.text: Quality is really good, and earpads are extremely soft(when i was reading reviews about it i was most scared about earache situations(!)) . Im using with ios and i never had issue, immediate connection. Battery life more than okay for this price. If you are music listener sound is clean and clear. If i match with another headsets what i had before and material about $200-$300 scala worth it.
customer_reviews.author: CaptainWhite

customer_reviews.title: Sold USED as NEW
customer_reviews.text: Tribit sold me a use product as new. The instructions state "Tribit XFree Tune" as the device pairing name. However, when setting my bluetooth device to pair, name wasn't "Tribit XFree Tune" but was "JIONG BEAR JB1". I didn't edit the name to be "JIONG BEAR JB1" So, where did "JIONG BEAR JB1" come from?
customer_reviews.author: M. Fields

customer_reviews.title: Horrible sound
customer_reviews.text: Too much bass! In order to hear the higher tones, I have to turn the volume so high that the bass rumbling is very annoying. I'm returning them!
customer_reviews.author: John W Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Very large on you head.
customer_reviews.text: The earphone quality is very clunky now it is $50 for these headphones and that I did take into consideration before writing this review. The sound quality is what you would expect for $50 your phones. The tribit I was expecting a little bit more from you considering you're trying to rival competitors in your range. Thank you for allowing me to test them out but I'm looking for a little better quality which means I'm going to have to spend a lot more money thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Taran Navy

customer_reviews.title: The build quality and the battery life is excellent. However
customer_reviews.text: Been using these for over 6 months. The battery life still holds up great. The sound and the build quality is excellent. Good bass. Tribit team has excellent customer service and they approached me to make sure I was having a great experience with these headphones. It is definitely a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Varun krishna

customer_reviews.title: Very little artiulation in the ear cups can make these uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.text: These are actually pretty nice headphones for the price. Basic Bluetooth headphones with no bells and whistles like ANC or EQ modes. Ear cups are soft and large, but the lack of articulation is a big issue. This means you cannot get the ear cups exactly fit to your head/ears, so it may cause stress or pain after using for a while. This is exacerbated for those with larger heads where the headband must be extended more, creating even more of an angled fit. It's too bad these have this design flaw, because other than that they are very solid earphones. The EarFun Wave appear to be nearly the exact same headphones if you look those up.
customer_reviews.author: HLA

customer_reviews.title: Power Button Goes Out, Making Them Useless
customer_reviews.text: Headphones worked great, for great, had very long battery life, excellent noise cancellation, and great sound. BUT after 4 months, the power button just stopped working altogether. It seems to be stuck in a permanently depressed position, so it is impossible to turn the headphones on or off. I’ve tried pulling the button back up but it will not budge, so the headphones are now unusable. Doesn’t do any good to have awesome headphones if you can’t turn them on. In hopes that it was just a fluke pair, I tried to exchange them for a new pair on amazon, but apparently they are outside of the return period.
customer_reviews.author: George Koehl

customer_reviews.title: Quality on the cheap
customer_reviews.text: I really like these headphones! They seem to be well made and of good quality. They are comfortable, even for longer periods of use. The sound quality is very good. I my other pair of headphones are the Bose QC25's and they are fairly close in sound but nowhere near in noise cancelling abilities... but then again, I don't think these claim any or much noise cancelling abilities. I really like the "cord-free" dynamic compared to my Bose QC25's which are corded. Overall, these were a great little pickup for the money and I would recommend to a friend or family member.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Flick

customer_reviews.title: NOT noise canceling
customer_reviews.text: Biggest gripe is this is definitely not noise cancelling. I have tried a Bose noise cancelling headphone and you really hear a marked difference when you put the headphones on. The background noise drops a ton. These headphones feel like normal over-the-ear headphones whose only background noise reduction comes from the fact that it covers your entire ear. That being said, I'm impressed with the battery life, comfort and overall sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: Ken H

customer_reviews.title: Updated Review: Broken After 6 Weeks
customer_reviews.text: After ordering these headphones they unfortunately broke after a few weeks. The company contacted me and asked me if they could send me a new pair and that now they were providing cases. I have had the new pair for a couple months now and they work great, I travel with them all the time. I don't think there is a better headphone for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon W.

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Sound Quality.  If you don't care about the Bulk, these are fantastic.
customer_reviews.text: Update 9/17/2019: Break-in period completed. Also honeymoon period is over. And I can say without reservation these headphones are fantastic, at any price point. Let alone for under $40! A best Buy. I tested several wireless headphones in the $40 range, and these have by far the BEST sound quality of them all. No other one came close! I only complain about the bulk and they do look a little goofy on my average sized head. I wish the design was sleeker with slimmer pads. However they are extremely comfortable. Ultimately, you won't find better sound at this price. They sound comparable to my studio quality Sony headphones ($80 wired headphones). Sound quality is king, and these rock. Fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Jester

customer_reviews.title: Way too loud, uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in these headphones. First, maybe it's just me, but they are very uncomfortable. They put way to much pressure on my ears, so much so that my ear contacts the hard plastic part. Despite sealing well, they don't block out much outside noise, even in my quiet office. Lastly, they are way too loud. Even on the lowest setting, they are above what I would like. So if you like to listen to things at a moderate volume, these are not for you.
customer_reviews.author: K. Prom

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound and Comfort
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Bluetooth headset I have tried and it has surpassed my hopes for it after my first trial of another brand went to the trashcan. I've used it for both music and voice (Audiobooks) while riding my stationary indoor bike for winter exercise. The sound quality of the voices I've listened to so far is pleasant and very understandable and the music range is balanced to my liking. No problem with comfort for the 30-45" time I wear them. I generally keep them on the charger when not in use so battery life is so far not an issue. For my use the are perfect and I can recommend them, especially at the Amazon price.
customer_reviews.author: Old Dick31

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a few months of use
customer_reviews.text: The top of the headset broke after a few months of use... so disappointing. Right now it's being held by duct tape until I can get another pair. The sound quality is decent (and so is the battery life...) but the construction quality is crap :(
customer_reviews.author: Deena Miller

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, great sounding, long lasting battery, GOOD HEADPHONES
customer_reviews.text: I'm not going to lie, I have never had wireless headphones before, so I can't speak from experience. But for someone who has no money for Beats headphones, or some other expensive crap, these are great. These headphones right here, they're some baaaaddd... mothe.....SHUT YO MOUTH! Just talking bout Tribit XFree Tune Bluetooth Headphones! They are comfy, I've worn mine for 3+ hours, and didn't suffer too much ear hurt. The sound goes good and loud. The batteries seem to last a long time. Big bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.author: Igor2tall

customer_reviews.title: Tribit Failed Almost Exactly the Day before the Review Window Closed
customer_reviews.text: Generally speaking, I liked the Tribit Bluetooth for the quality of its sound. On the other hand, they are quite bulky. When used while wearing eyeglasses, they also become uncomfortable pretty quickly. This may be because I have a big head. However, the left ear failed a couple of days after the window for return closed. A device with solid construction (which this one appears to have) should not be so poorly wired as to fail. Its failure prompted me to seek out an earbud alternative, even though I find headphones more comfortable to use in our setting.
customer_reviews.author: Ted LehmannTop Contributor: Country Music

customer_reviews.title: Seems Pretty Limited
customer_reviews.text: I primarily purchased this headset for use with my Amazon Fire Cube. The headset paired quickly and easily with the cube... and that's it. It won't pair with my iMac, my MacBook Pro, my iPad, or anything else I've tried. The device will search and search, but the TriBit never appears on the Bluetooth list. At least I have the option of connecting with a mini jack extension cable (the included cable is very short), and the sound quality is decent, but I'm quite disappointed with the other technical capabilities I was expecting when purchasing, and can't find many solutions in the product's support page online. Semi/fail.
customer_reviews.author: Solo Goodspeed

customer_reviews.title: I'm here buying another pair
customer_reviews.text: My son loves these. I bought them so he could do his zoom classes when schools shut down for covid19 My wife borrowed them and loved them. I bought her a different pair that she approved of when I showed them to her online. She hated them. they weren't as comfortable, they didn't sound as good, they didn't cancel noise as well. So I am here buy the same exact ones I bought for my son. They cancel noise out so much I have to toss things at her to get her attention. They both really like them and for the price they are a great deal!
customer_reviews.author: RayL

customer_reviews.title: If you want a cheap pair a phones, then:
customer_reviews.text: These things are a waste of money. The bluetooth wouldn't stay connected. I have another pair of older JBL's, they stay connected. The volume control on the phones themselves wouldn't work also. On the wired side the phones did work and the sound was okay. They were kinda cheap and definitely lived up to it. I guess the saying holds true " Buy cheap you get cheap" Needless to say, they were returned.
customer_reviews.author: Ace in Colorado

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up, easy to use, great sound
customer_reviews.text: I use this to watch TV when I am working in the kitchen and can't hear it, or when my son is doing homework and I don't want to bother him. The set up is easy, as is the use. The range is far - through walls and doors in some instances, as I walk the house doing chores. Excellent value. Hoping that Tribit is still donating $1 to United States Fund for UNICEF in return for my leaving this review - I paid full price for my product, but am happy to make the effort of leaving a review if it supports a program like this.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Bee

customer_reviews.title: Impressive quality at a low price
customer_reviews.text: I’m a musician and I love love love these headphones. They are far superior in sound quality to headphones that cost WAY more. If you like a super bassy sound these may not be for you; but if you prefer a well-balanced ear, these are amazingly good. They have a very nice clarity of range, and the mic works great for phone calls, too. They are very well-made; fold easily, are comfortable on the head and on the ear (important to big-haired, big-headed folks who hate earbuds like myself.) I’m definitely planning on purchasing their more expensive headphones too. Worth every penny, and it felt good supporting a smaller company
customer_reviews.author: Aisha Nikki Greenlee

customer_reviews.title: Very Impressive! Was not expecting this out of Affordable headphones
customer_reviews.text: I got these headphones on black friday so I could have a pair of wireless headphones for sitting in bed a night watching YouTube Video and watching movies occasionally. I was blown away with the quality for the price of these headphones. These have some good bass with clear Treble. I could not see myself spending 4-6 times the cost of these for "Premium" brand names. These perform really well. I would buy these again for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Feinberg

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: What a find! I’m no audiophile , but these are a big step-up from my Skullcandys. Really, really nice sound, maybe a bit basey (geared toward the young), but even Youtube videos are dramatically better. I really love the sound quality for around $50. Can’t go wrong—and even my audiophile friends were impressed with the sound at this price point... And they stay charged forever. They also connect faster and better than any other Bluetooth device I have ever used. Great! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Todd MarchTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: They broke, however, company REPLACED and shipped in 1-2 days! Will purchase again.
customer_reviews.text: Revised product review....Grandson's headphones broke, however after some research, contacted the manufacturer and headphones were REPLACED immediately. I purchased a 2nd pair for another family member (8 months later as a Christmas gift) and was going to purchase a 3rd pair for granddaughter.....when the original broke, it was disappointing ...however with the quality assurance of the manfacturing behind the product. I will purchase again. :) Replacement was quickly shipped and very much appreciated by myself and family.
customer_reviews.author: SueT

customer_reviews.title: Excellent - as good as my Boses
customer_reviews.text: I bought low-end Bose (not noise cancelling) earphones and these at the same time, and tried them both extensively. The sound quality and bass are very, very similar. So at the much lower price, I recommend these very, very strongly! They are bulkier, but form a tighter seal around the ear. Maybe a little tight for people like me who have a big head? They even come with a solid case!
customer_reviews.author: BobInBrooklyn

customer_reviews.title: Good sound quality, but...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these a couple ago, they are well made and sound pretty good, I like that they also come with a case, but since about 2 weeks ago, sometimes it seems that one speaker loses signal and then it comes back, it has been becoming more frequent. I would have given this 5 stars, but because of these I rate them with 2. Update: I contacted customer service about the problem, they refunded my payment, great service
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Good for listening...Terrible for phone calls
customer_reviews.text: Cancels out outside noice pretty good. Overall sound is decent and bass is good. Not super high quality but good for the price point. Might as well not have a mic for phone calls as my voice sounds muffled to the other person and the mic's pics up every sound around me and amplifies it to the other person. Even driving, the other person can sometimes here road noise which is silly considering I'm in a car that is pretty quiet. But it really amplifies the slightest sound. Annoying. Ok to get by for listening to music but for calls.....absolutely Not.
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly Good
customer_reviews.text: These are as good as other reviewers have suggested. They seem quite sturdy. Ear cup surrounds are a very flexible rubber while not sound proof they do a fairly good job at reducing external noise. They paired up with my Acer Chromebook 14 with no issues with a range around 12'ish feet line of sight. I've had a little trouble finding the volume control at first as they don't really stand out tactically very well. Just a matter of getting familiar. So far so good. Very impressive.
customer_reviews.author: Catman

customer_reviews.title: Good Headphone
customer_reviews.text: Cheap headphone with great bass and treble sound when playing music but it’s not good for taking phone calls. Can barely hear anything on phone calls.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Sound
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why, especially since 1 wk before I purchased TaoTronics (TT-BH040) which are nice for the price. Also boasting ANC, Deep Base etc. Well folks these Tribit XFree BLOWS Them Away! OMG! Very good quality, very comfortable, & True To Life Audio w/genuine Deep Base. 35 yrs of Audio, Vid, & Broadcasting, & I've prob worn over 20 diff headsets & the Tribit XFree is definitely the most comfortable w/high quality, while rivaling $300 sets w/its sound. So I implore you, if you desire Quality, Comfort, & True To Life Audio, buy these now! OK, you've been fed. I'm going for 2nd's before the price goes up. Happy listening :^)
customer_reviews.author: Puma

customer_reviews.title: Flimzy, cheap, battery life isn't on par with the claimed rating of 40 hours. hours,
customer_reviews.text: Very flimzy, the volume and power buttons are baldy placed and get pressed all the time. The sound quality is ok but the headphones themselves are made of really cheap material, even for the price they're sold, they also disconnect on their own all the time. Most importantly though, the batter life is NOWHERE NEAR the advertised mark, not even half way there. Also, the earpiece fell off the next day and I had to get another one.
customer_reviews.author: K. O.

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones
customer_reviews.text: Had it for about 2 months. So far works great. I would give it 9/10. They last a long time before you have to recharge them. I’ve watched 5 movies no problem and I would recharge after that, but not because I had too, because I didn’t wanna get caught without batteries next time. I’m sure I could watch 10-15 movies (2hrs each) without needing to recharge. Noise from outside is pretty low to non existent do to them covering the whole ear. No complaints. Also distance is at least 7-10 feet, that’s all I needed, I’m sure they could go further. For the price you won’t find better ones.
customer_reviews.author: nick

customer_reviews.title: Great for watching tv while other are around.
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased many headphones that were much more expensive than these that didn't perform as good as these. They are very loud and holds a long charge. I have purchased 2 so I can rotate them out after a couple of movies. Most of the time, I get about 6 - 8 hours out of them before needing to recharge.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable!
customer_reviews.text: Sound is ok. But they are very heavy and super uncomfortable to wear...i can barely wear them for 10 min. Padding isn't good and it hurts my ears. I bought them over 10 months ago and used them maybe 5 times. Waste of 50 bucks!
customer_reviews.author: Yisroel Barkany

customer_reviews.title: Excellent headphones
customer_reviews.text: I bought this headphone because of the excellent reviews and it was in my price range. I use headphones a lot and they usually break after 6 months to a year so I couldn't justify the 2-300 dollars for a headphones. The headphone is very nice looking and seems well built, folded i the case, it's kind of bid. The sound is excellent especially the high and medium. The bass however lacks seriously It's not active noise cancelling but does a good job isolating outside noise. In conclusion this is an excellent headphone for who listen to music with soft sound. Hip hop listeners might want to try something else because of the low bass.
customer_reviews.author: charles

customer_reviews.title: FINALLY headphones that sound great and don't bother my earrings
customer_reviews.text: I've been struggling for years trying to find solid, somewhat inexpensive quality headphones and these are it. They connect so quickly to all bluetooth sources (phone, laptop, speakers) and they sound great. Maybe best of all, they don't bother my ears when I have earrings in at all. Minor but not. It still hurts to wear glasses and headphones but no one has solved that problem yet. These are great, highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: PLS

customer_reviews.title: As my buddy used to say, "Nearly perfect..."
customer_reviews.text: I was originally looking for noise cancelling headphones. What I didn't realize is that "CVC 6.0 Noise Cancellation for Hands-Free Call" meant noise cancelling only for phone calls. Otherwise, these are solid, comfortable headphones that block most outside sound and sound pretty darned good. I kept them for home use, and my kids pair them with their phones and Chromebooks and am going to have to get a 2nd pair to keep them happy! My workplace requires noise-cancelling headsets or earplugs so, I had to get something different. But, overall, these are super nice! Tribit, make these a full-on noise-cancelling headset, and they'd be perfect! :-)
customer_reviews.author: KurtB

customer_reviews.title: I love these headphones
customer_reviews.text: I have owned numerous Bluetooth headphones and ear buds over the past few years. I use them almost everyday for several hours minimum. These are very solid, well crafted, sound great and the over the ear style works great for noise canceling. They are comfortable to wear for long periods of time. The battery time is excellent. Best of all is the price. Well worth the price. I would buy them again without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Peters

customer_reviews.title: They sound really nice
customer_reviews.text: I got these to zone out when I study. I use my bose sound sport free that I've had for over two years without complaint, and these sound right above there with them. When I play games on my computer, I use them wired, and they sound super lovely. I can hear the directional sound. Oh, and I've been using them for a little over a week (mostly connected when gaming) and wireless when I study for hours, and I still have a charge. I'm surprised, and I strongly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Juanis

customer_reviews.title: Above Average Overall
customer_reviews.text: $50 for the XFree Tune is a very good deal. Sound quality was better than I expected. Sounded even better with a slight EQ adjustment on my smartphone. Wired,it sounded the same as Bluetooth. In comparison,the Ncredible1 sounded muddy,compromised by on-ear pads (difficult get a good seal), shorter battery life and is overpriced in my opinion. Build quality for the Xfree left me underwhelmed. It's not bad but I do feel the over-ear pads would deteriorate,rip or tear in a short amount of time especially if care is not taken. I also noticed a slight separation in the padded headband. That could worse over time.
customer_reviews.author: Dwayne White

customer_reviews.title: Great value headphones to use in the gym
customer_reviews.text: I like the fit and sound of theses headphones. They aren't for audiophiles, but they are great in the gym where the musice sources is a bluetooth connection from an elliptical machine. They stay on my head comfortably for an hour and mask out substantial external noise because they cover the ears (they are not noise cancelling). They pair rapidly with the bluetooth signals from the gym equipment, so all is well. My only difficulty is changing the volume with them on. It takes me a while to find the volume switch and move it in the correct direction. Overall, I would buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Gman

customer_reviews.title: For $26, this headphone is hard to beat
customer_reviews.text: I am an avid collector of headphones from the $5 earphones to the $350 headphones. For this headphone, I am going to compare it to my collection of $20 to $80 headphones. I was able to get this headphone at Amazon for $26. For the price and quality, I would easily put this headphone on the top of my $20-$80 collection. It is really that hard to beat. Now, if I can get the Anker Soundcore Life Q10 for the same $26 price then I would go with the Soundcore. Right now, the Soundcore is $29.99, unfortunately it does not come with a case. The Tribit Xfree comes with a hard case.
customer_reviews.author: jrx1024

customer_reviews.title: Good budget headphones with an important drawback.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones offer a reasonable value for the price. They are comfortable, well built and have a stellar battery life. The sound quality will be acceptable and perhaps good for most. I found the bass to be bloated (something you may like), the mids recessed and the treble rather "frazzling" . For some songs the treatment of the treble was rather poor and instruments sounded like static as opposed to.......well..... instruments. But for the price.... It's okay... Perhaps good. If you are on a budget this is a very good option. Side note: The design of the ear cups allows for less conspicuous wearing than other headphones; something you may not notice until you put them on.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Well constructed and great sound.
customer_reviews.text: 5 stars for the price for sure. I have had several over the ear Bluetooth headphones. The construction of these are great. There are no screws to loosen over time. I have had that issue a couple of times. The sound is great for music and audiobooks. They block out the noise from the tools and power equipment I use. They are lightweight and very comfortable. I have had these a couple of months and held off for my review to be sure of the quality. Also they fold up really well for packing and transport. I travel at least two weeks a month and no issue at all.
customer_reviews.author: Shane S.

customer_reviews.title: Inferior product
customer_reviews.text: Only lasts 9 months then it falls apart, literally. Mine broke in 4 places and the plastic stated shedding and came unglued. The sound is great; I patched up the hardware so it still functions but will not recommend the product due to its poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: rickoshay4u

customer_reviews.title: Truly excellent headphones for the price
customer_reviews.text: Why pay a lot of money when you can get great sound with the Tribit XFree headphones? These headphones sound amazing with all music, are comfortable, and have as long a battery life as advertised. When the headphones stopped charging after nearly a year, customer service was very caring and friendly. They are sending a replacement to me. So if you have an issue, do not worry. I am very happy I found these headphones!
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Tribit = WOW
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased the Bose QC35 a couple of months ago and was disappointed with the sound quality. Bose products 20 - 30 years ago produced incredible sound. I wanted another better sounding headset but was not going to spend the Bose price. I searched, read reviews and youtubed all weekend and was surprised to find the Tribit was highly rated and inexpensive. I took a chance on them and I was shocked at how well they sound and the quality of the product for 9× less the price. These headphones are sound engineered better the the bose QC35. Bose bass is muddy Tribit base= Boom Highs and Mids very good
customer_reviews.author: steve keen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are incredible. They have all day battery life, excellent volume, clarity, and noise reduction. The ear pads actually encase my entire ear too, which is nice. I have a $100 pair of Sony studio headphones and in terms of comfort and quality these come really close for roughly a third of the price. If you're looking quality budget Bluetooth headphones, I wholeheartedly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan W

customer_reviews.title: The Sound
customer_reviews.text: I Love Tribit, I first purchase the Tribit Bluetooth Speaker over a year ago, and i was very much impressed with it. So when I seen these Headphones, I know I could not go wrong, and I didn't. These Headphones are the "Business". I Love everything about them, the noise Cancellation is everything, the sound, the bass...I could go on and on. These are Amazing, and due to the fact i got these on "Todays Deals" for 25.99...You will not be disappointed. Once again, Thank You Amazon, you guys have not failed me yet.
customer_reviews.author: Hope

customer_reviews.title: Amazing. Also saved me from a concussion
customer_reviews.text: These literally saved me from a concussion. I fainted while using these, fell from standing up straight onto the concrete. The right earphone hit the ground and isn’t even scratched at all. And, best of all, no concussion for me! These are also amazing for the price. They aren’t noise cancelling, but the sound quality is unbeatable for the price. I’m very happy with them. The battery life also lasts seemingly forever and recharges at lightning speed. Can’t recommend these enough.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Value In An Inexpensive Headphone
customer_reviews.text: Purchase these headphones for my 17 year old son as a Christmas gift after reading a review on CNET. Was looking for a lower cost unit because he is notorious for breaking headphones with them typically lasting less than a year. When received, my son was thrilled with the sound quality and, after listening I was pleasantly surprised. The headphones appear very well made, are comfortable and provide an excellent balanced sound (I am used to listening to headphones costing 7x as much). I would highly recommend these headphones to anyone looking headphones in the $100 or less price range.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Underrated headphones !
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality of these is shockingly good considering it’s at the below 50$ range. Usually less expensive headphones = a sharp downfall in audio quality. However, the Tribit Xfree Tune is an incredible exception. It has a very round and high def sound. Very crisp and clear. They’re also very comfortable to wear. Only cons are the sound leak is pretty bad. But unless you’re really embarrassed of your own music taste this should not be an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Leonel

customer_reviews.title: GREAT QUALITY, GREAT PRICE WITHOUT COMPROMISING ANYTHING!! FANTASTIC!
customer_reviews.text: I decided to take a chance on these because there were and Amazin special for the day. I figured they'd work fine but didn't have huge expectations. I AM SO IMPRESSED!! I charged them and have been listening for 2 days on the charge and they're still going. The sound is great, super comfortable and lightweight and very easy to set up and use. I'm so happy I decided to take a chance of these, I'm only sorry that I didn't buy a few more at the lower price. That said, I will be buying more as gifts because even at the regular price they are a fantastic value!!
customer_reviews.author: Kymberly Koelln

customer_reviews.title: Customer support was great
customer_reviews.text: This headset worked great until it stopped working. Customer service was terrific once I finally was able to get ahold of them.
customer_reviews.author: A. Newberry

customer_reviews.title: THE HEADPHONE STOPPED WORKING
customer_reviews.text: When I initially bought it, I really enjoyed using them because the sound is amazing and it does a good job of canceling the noises. However, after 5 months the power button just stopped working. No matter how much I try to charge them or turn them on nothing is working. It almost feels like the power button is stuck. I do not know what to do because I really like them but they are useless to me now. I would really appreciate if I get a replacement or a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Headphones are great and the customer service is exceptional
customer_reviews.text: Based on the CNET reviews I had purchased Tribit XFree in Feb 2019 and the headphone is top class both from the sound and the build quality perspective. Impressed with the build quality, I ordered 4 more of these for my family and we all are equally impressed at the overall quality of the product. Recently one of the headphones ear muff/pad had peeled off and I enquired with the customer service if they could send me a replacement ear muff and to my surprise they offered to send me a new headphone at no cost. To have a great product and to top it off with excellent customer service is what differentiates great companies from good ones.
customer_reviews.author: ds

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought these headphones during the Black Friday/Cyber Monday deals for just a little over $30 (US). At that price these things are a steal, I have never personally owned a better pair. Sound quality is full and relatively well balanced, I haven't even bothered to set up an equalizer. I often find myself just getting totally lost in my music while using these over-the-ear headphones, and cannot recommend these strongly enough. Do not go out and buy a 200 dollar set of cans. Buy these instead. I am an amateur audiophile with some experience with sound systems, bluetooth speakers, and headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: This may be the best bang for the buck on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Amazon prides itself on offering a plethora of quality goods at low consumer cost- mainly because of low cost manufacturing. This may be one of the few items from a non-reputable company where I can really state they have figured out a way to produce a tremendous product at low consumer cost. How is this only $30? I’m blown away. This is like getting a new pair of quality good year welted oxfords for $80. MUST BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Sam S.

customer_reviews.title: (Was) Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Update: I’ve had these for a little over 2 months and the sound quality is now abysmal and they need to be replaced just a week or so after losing the 60 day return policy. Obviously not worth the price for 2 months of audio. Original: (5 star) Feels like BEATS quality for a much better price. When you turn them on or off a voice says “powering on/off” which is weird but not a big deal. Battery lasts a long time.
customer_reviews.author: California Dreaming

customer_reviews.title: On a budget, look no further.
customer_reviews.text: We live in a world of comparison. Be it jobs, cars, hair, clothes..etc. You get the picture. I come from getting budget headphones from around $50-$70 bucks. I've had quite a few of them through the years and I must say they keep getting better as technology improves. I got these Tribit Xfree headphones. Boy, do they sound nice. They feel nice too. Good bass, decent mids and highs. Volume is loud enough. Connection is clear and stable. Its a world of difference seeing the comparison what is and what was. For $40 bucks and with some review research. Hard to believe there $40 bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Tawanamonica Spence

customer_reviews.title: Even better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for headphones to replace my fraying Sennheisers, and these had good reviews and were relatively cheap. I haven't had wireless headphones before and was impressed with the sound quality - I can't tell the difference in sound between when it is wired and when it is wireless. The charge also lasts a really long time. It's not great for calls (sound quality drops significantly and the mic seems spotty), but I love these as general headphones!
customer_reviews.author: cl

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional Bass and Build Quality
customer_reviews.text: Great Headset. Just don’t like the brand name lol. Tried Soundcore Vortex and Tribit so far. The Tribit wins when it comes to richness of the sound. If you want bass like I do then buy this. Soundcore is also very rich on bass, just that Tribit stands out and it is less expensive too
customer_reviews.author: NanaGenfi

customer_reviews.title: These headphones are surprisingly good.
customer_reviews.text: I love them. Bought them since I had always wanted a pair of bluetooth headphones, but I was hesitant. For my surprise, the sound is very good quality (for what I need). The feature that I did not see (my fault) was is that it has a microphone and, again, it performs better (for me) than the desktop microphone that I own; in the sense that it works for what I need and cuts most of my (horrible) breaths and clicks (not for pro-recording purposes). Battery life is darn good and it I have had no need to charge it yet. I would strongly suggest for you to at least give it a chance....excellent product, for what it's worth.
customer_reviews.author: Andrés García

customer_reviews.title: great deal, great sound
customer_reviews.text: lost a pair of wireless beats and couldn’t bare to spend 300 on another pair. hope someone appreciates you beats :( looked into tribit and took a chance, but i have to say they are comparable. i’m no audio pro, but these are fantastic. great range. my wife is studying for the gmats so our place is quieter than a buddhist temple, but my ears are in a movie theater. only a month in, can’t speak for durability, but great so far. also have not tried the built in mic..
customer_reviews.author: TN

customer_reviews.title: Broke within a Year/ Charging Problems
customer_reviews.text: I have had these for almost exactly a year. I take care with them, transport them in a case, and today I reached for them and the pin connecting the one side of the earphones came out. I taped it, but it just seems to me this shouldn't happen. Also, I have had some charging issues--I leave it plugged for a day, and it doesn't charge. I think there may be a problem with the connection. I left them charging all day--didn't work, and now it doesn't even fit on my ear because it broke. Bummed, I use them a lot.
customer_reviews.author: yamanan

customer_reviews.title: Great for its price, seem durable and can be used wireless and with a wire.
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable, although I got a headache at first because I wasn’t used to the pressure on my head. It is a little heavy but can be overlooked. The sound is good, not bad not the best as many have said, but I’m satisfied and will be using these for a long time. The Bluetooth is easy to do and I love that you can fold these up. They came with a pouch as well as it’s charging cable and cord to connect with your computer/phone/etc. The buttons are pretty easy to find as well. Honestly great headphones and can go pretty loud.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia M.

customer_reviews.title: I cant believe these are not 3x the price!
customer_reviews.text: These are so amazing! I bought 2 sets for my daughters and they love them. The battery last for several days even with moderate use, and the audio quality is much better than I was expecting for this price point. I am considering buying a pair for myself to avoid the day to day the wear and tear on my bose headset. These are every bit as good as my bose except they dont have noise cancelling. I just cant say enough good things about these, and if you are reading this... buy them as you will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: WFKV

customer_reviews.title: NOT durable under constant use
customer_reviews.text: Bought this headset for my autistic daughter, who uses headphones constantly, hoping it would be more durable than the more expensive earphones we'd bought from Sony. They only lasted 3 months before the usual thing happened: the part that enables he earpiece to pivot broke. They still sound good, but its duct tape time. (Wish somebody would create a more durable pair of headphones!) Sony at lasted 18 months before the same thing happened, but they were $200 as compared to $40, so I guess comparatively speaking, its okay
customer_reviews.author: Cat Young

customer_reviews.title: Great quality Bluetooth headphones!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, Very comfortable and light weight, Sound is nice and clear Loud. I like bass but if you like a pair of Bluetooth headphones that have plenty of treble and bass without the bass being ridiculously thumping, This is the perfect pair of Bluetooth headphones for you. They come with a very durable carrying case and an aux wire for wired listening. So when you run out of battery life you can continue listening. And you can use them on non Bluetooth devices with The included wire. I still don't know the full battery life but it's LONG! A LOT OF DEVIL'S SAY THAT THEY HAVE A LONG BATTERY LIFE, BUT THIS ONE BACKS UP THE ADD LOL.
customer_reviews.author: Nick S.

customer_reviews.title: Bummer
customer_reviews.text: Way too loud from the outside... more of a Bluetooth speaker than anything.. really pisses me off because I thought these would be good based on ratings but I guess nobody else cares about others around them.. sound is just as loud outside as inside
customer_reviews.author: KARADINE

customer_reviews.title: Sound good, reasonably comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Wife beginning to have trouble hearing the TV. Looked at the options, and opted to try these phones through the Bluetooth feature on our Yamaha A/V receiver. Was fearful of latency, but, depending on the source, it is minimal. Watching movies from the DVR, the delay is totally acceptable. Do I credit Yamaha or Tribit? At any rate, you don't often see the use of A/V receiver via Bluetooth to enabled phones being touted--but in my case it works. The sound and range are very good for TV applications. I'm happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Gibiphone

customer_reviews.title: amazing deal
customer_reviews.text: OK lets start with the cons,the volume up or down does not work with 3.5 mm jack connected,so what. pretty much that is it. This is about amazing sound on a budget. you get a very high quality sound for not a lot of $$$. Are these gonna be 150 to 200 dollar heads phone? No, but they can hold their own. The ratings do not lie. I hear instruments that I never knew was on my music list.. I am amazed on how they can sell these for the price. anywho stop reading this and pick up a pair.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are very nice sounding headphones
customer_reviews.text: These are very nice sounding headphones, well worth the price, I just choose the nose 25 and will keep these in mind if I need a spare. This is a follow up review after receiving a message from amazon. These headphones are nice. The issue is condition of damage to the package, box they were in as well as the headphones themselves. Picture shows all. I was told by amazon I did not need to return damaged item and I would be receiving a replacement. Now I have been told by email to return the damaged ones or be charged. What does amazon want?????
customer_reviews.author: DMD

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are poorly designed. The volume control is very cumbersome and difficult to use. Almost blasted my head off, it was so loud. I own other Tribit products and have been very satisfied with them. Not so with these headphones. By the time I got to try them it was too late to return. Very, very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Best sounding headphones in this price range
customer_reviews.text: I was in the market for a above average set of Bluetooth headphones at a reasonable price. After reading lots of reviews on several tech sites I decided to pull the trigger on tribit xfree tune and I’m really pleased with this choice. Easy to use controls and sound quality is great especially in this price range. Ear muffs are very comfortable and made of good material. SIRI integration is a plus. Hands free call are clear. Pairing is a breeze. A Must have !!!
customer_reviews.author: rizy

customer_reviews.title: Great value, instant Bluetooth connection, fantastic sound and clarity.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic value for the price. I haven't tried other noise cancelling headphones so can't compare, but these do a great job of blocking out background noise. I've used them for many different things like blocking out the noise of a 2-stroke backpack leaf-blower, as a headset for WebEx conferencing, and for listening to music in a noisy wood-shop. Bluetooth connection after initial pairing is almost instantaneous...better than any other Bluetooth device I've ever use. Lightweight, compact, can be used cordless or corded, and has a great battery life. I would definitely recommend these as a much less expensive alternative to a $300 set of NC headphones.
customer_reviews.author: C D Jones

customer_reviews.title: Prefer them over my home theater!
customer_reviews.text: I watched a couple-three hours of reviews on YouTube and decided on these. I live in an apartment building and watch TV late night without bothering or waking the neighbors. The foam on the ear pads are so comfortable, I often fall asleep with my headphones on. Umm...like almost every night. I have a home theater and prefer my Bluetooth headphones!!
customer_reviews.author: Elvira (Ehl-vee-rah)

customer_reviews.title: Great audio but bad build.
customer_reviews.text: I was happy with the audio but 9 months later the damn things snapped. They were well taken care of. From the look of it, the plastic pieces were just held together with glue only just above the joint. This glue lost its stick and that put way to much pressure on the plastic that was left. So the feel like quality but they are not.
customer_reviews.author: mirrymirsome

customer_reviews.title: Listen! this is an unbelievable deal full-stop!
customer_reviews.text: This headphone shocked me with its overall build quality and sound! build quality on on par with any 200-400 head phone and the sound won't let you down either. Battery is crazy good it's like it never needs to charge once you charge it up very impressive. Don't let the price fool you. If I told you I paid 300 for these and made you hold and listen it you WOULD believe me!
customer_reviews.author: Orrin

customer_reviews.title: That bass yo!
customer_reviews.text: If you like bass, these are best cans you can get in the price range. But don't let that price fool you, these things bang! They don't have ANC or any other gimmick but what they do, they do great. As you can pretty much tell the bass on these is sensational. It thumps without sounding 'too made up' if you know what I mean. And it doesn't distort either at loud volumes. Build quality is also great. Sure they're mostly plastic but very well made. Had these for about a week before my wife appropriated them for herself. Sigh...have to get another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Hillary

customer_reviews.title: I am VERY DISAPPOINTED in this product.
customer_reviews.text: I am VERY DISAPPOINTED in this product. I have only used it for 3 months and it’s now broken:( I mostly use it at the office. I realized a few weeks ago that it had started cracking as you see in the attached photos. Finally today they broke as I was putting them on my head. I DO NOT RECOMMEND ANYONE BUYING THESE HEADPHONES. I bought a cheaper set of headphones from another company for my kids when I bought mine, my kids headphones are still working excellent!!
customer_reviews.author: John Nyago

customer_reviews.title: Just Give them a try
customer_reviews.text: For the price so far has exceeded expectations. I was looking for an affordable go to pair of headphones primarily for the gym because I'm a gym rat. A few things are priority volume Bluetooth range battery life durability and affordability as I will probably destroy them and need a new pair. For volume these exceeded my expectations very loud comfortable and range allows me to move freely in the gym. As far as durability that remains to be seen as that would take some time for me to confirm. Awesome job if they last you have a customer for life.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew P.

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones for the money
customer_reviews.text: I got these for Christmas and had never had any before. I really never thought about owning any or thought I would use them. Boy was I wrong. I love these. I can listen to what I want when my husband is watching football or any of this shows i'm not interested in. I use them much more that I thought I would. For the money you can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: C. Damitz

customer_reviews.title: Sound is fine, but battery life is lower than stated - Updated Aug 2020
customer_reviews.text: The headphones are comfortable and the sound is fine. The stated battery life of 40 hours is not accurate in my case. Battery life lasts about 6-8 hours after a full charge. Best to choose a different brand. Updated Aug 2020 Had a replacement pair for less than a year. Last night, the headphone broke on one side of the headset. One more reason to find a different brand
customer_reviews.author: Slicers

customer_reviews.title: Sounds like my Beats Studio 3 at a fraction of the cost.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a pair of Beats Studio 3 a year and a half ago and the headband cracked recently. What was even more disappointing is that it would cost 200.00 to repair or replace them because they were out of the one year warranty. So I saw a review about these online and after reading more reviews here on Amazon decided to give them a try. SO GLAD I DID! They sound so much like my Beats that I truly cannot tell a difference. Great sound and I love the long battery life. For 40.00 you can’t beat the price for such a great value! Saved hundreds of dollars and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: simplytalented93

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought three of these tribit BT headphones .I appreciate their good quality sound nice bass long listening battery power. They are comfortable, the case is a plus but I bought them for the sound. price cannot be beaten. Gave one to my husband for a b-day gift. He loves it.
customer_reviews.author: grandmama

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for granddaughter - she is happy with them
customer_reviews.text: Granddaughter says sound quality is good except base is a little weak. Doesn't seem to have any noise cancelling properties other than it "cuffs" over your ears. Charging is good and lasts quite a while. She says they are comfortable to wear and she likes the protective case since exposed items in her house tend to be damaged by siblings.
customer_reviews.author: Flyinglow

customer_reviews.title: Sony just got Sonned
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't consider myself an audiophile, but having owned five Sony headphones in three years is like being an abusive relationship, as four of them have all broken at the hinge, mind you with no negligence, and with bad horrible customer service to accompany it. It wasn't till recently my last Sony's broke, that I just started adding mileage to my Tribits, and I've missed out on how phenomenal these sound, plus with Google Assistant and Spotify/Google Music, what a deal as you're getting close to a fully immersive experience at a fraction of a cost. If you're in the market for noise-canceling headphones or for a set with punchy bass, these are not Bose's or Skullcandy's.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Sabino

customer_reviews.title: Excellent buy for a low price.
customer_reviews.text: In general, this product is excellent. It is not designed for noise cancelling, though the over the ear design does cancel some sound. Sound quality is excellent. Bass, mid, and treble all comes through clearly. These are the most comfortable headphones I have used. Bluetooth connection has no issues and the range is very long for any normal use, even reaching across a 200 meter track. They look great and the case is sleek and sturdy. My primary concern is that the power button and volume buttons stopped functioning in under a year, but Tribit replaced them free of charge.
customer_reviews.author: Tagliacozzi

customer_reviews.title: 1 Microphone engineering decision away from being great!
customer_reviews.text: These things are pretty awesome. They work flawlessly and it's awesome that you can use them by just plugging in a cable from the headphones to whatever 3.5mm device you want to hear sound from. However, for some odd reason, they decided to disable the microphone when tethered into a device with a cable? It's such a weird thing that I never expected would be a "feature". I was disappointed because I was really hoping to use them to play XBox on but without the mic, what's the point. It does however work just fine via blue tooth so with your phone it's pretty awesome but unfortunately they just fell a little bit short for my intended purposes
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: You will love these headphones!!!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic sounding headphones with an ok build quality, best $40 I've ever spent. Had planned on purchasing the Sony WH-1000xm3's but after listening to these I no longer need the Sony anc because the passive noise isolation on this unit is pretty good and the sound is about 95 percent as good as the Sony's. These are better than my Cowin E7, and slightly better than my Sivga V007 and definitely better than my Fidelio X2HR. When using with Bluetooth the bass can occasionally sound a little heavy but when using with the 3.5 mm plug everything smooth s out really good
customer_reviews.author: Ken Baskin

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy for PC or Laptop use.
customer_reviews.text: I found many great reviews for these headphones, unfortunately they are no good with computers. I had them work great for a couple gaming sessions on my desktop then afterwards there was always interference issues resulting in poor sound. I tried with my laptop as well with the same result in a different location ( different state even) turned off bletooth on my nearby phone to no avail. On my cell phone the work great and live up to the hype. Do not buy these if you are planning on pairing with a PC or Laptop.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Best bluetooth headphones under $100
customer_reviews.text: for the 30-some bucks you spend, you get more than moneys worth. Bluetooth is snappy and hasn't cut out so far. They get a bit hot if you're someone, like me, who can't take hot weather. However the ear foam is dead and comfy. They sound amazing, much more so than we deserve for only $30. Do they bead sennheiser hd280's in sound reproduction? No, but they're easily the best wireless option anywhere even close to this price range.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Why pay more???
customer_reviews.text: I travel a lot and needed a compact pair of headphones that are comfortable and have a wired option for the t.v. screens on the planes. These fit completely over my ears and I can wear them for hours. The Sony's I had sat right on my ears and were very uncomfortable. So I purchased a pair of beats and sure they look cool but I couldn't justify the price for the build quality and the sound so I returned them. These sound as good as much higher priced headphones and for the money I couldn't resist. They are worth every penny!!!

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality, a little tight on a large head
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality and physical feel of these headphones are great, I am actually very impressed at this price point. The only thing I'm currently struggling with is how unforgiving these are on a larger head, it is currently putting a lot of pressure on the sides of my head.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch G.

product_meta.title: Tribit XFree Tune Bluetooth Headphones, [40h Playtime] Bluetooth Headphones Over Ear with Hi-Fi Stereo Sound & Rich Bass, Cnet's Award, Comfortable Headphones with Microphone & Foldable, Black
product_meta.description:
Color:Black

Tribit -- Wireless Audio to Amplify Your Life! Superior Hi-Fi Sound - Tribit XFree Tune over ear headphone deliver true stereo HD sound with rock-solid bass, super-crisp treble. Dual 40mm drivers and extended frequency range bring you the best music experience. Adopted high definition sensitive microphone, it allows you to pick up the incoming phone call, wireless talking, free your both hands.

Never Power Off - Support both wireless and wired modes. Extended high capacity battery provides up to 40 hours continuous music and phone call with wireless. Used as a wired headphone with an audio cable plugged into your earphone jack. Change from wireless headphones to wired headphones in seconds. You could use it at any time and any where, the foldable headset is very suitable for work and travel.

Comfortable Feeling - The comfortable head beam design and the use of cortical earmuffs, so we feel that the over ear bluetooth headphone boasts craftsmanship and comfort of wear. The headset has unique design allows fold neatly into the carry case for easy storage, also make for portable use. Weighs 10.08 Ounces, made of lightweight solid materials, improved structure. Tribit XFree Tune is much lighter (10%-20% lighter) and more comfortable than many other brand headphones.

Advanced Compatibility - Bluetooth 4.1 and CSR chips technology, 1.5x faster than traditional Bluetooth headphones. You could use it up to 33 feet away from your electronic equipment with its wireless Bluetooth technology. Tribit XFree Tune connect seamlessly with all Bluetooth enabled devices, like iPhone, iPad, Samsung Galaxy phones, tablets, laptops and so on.
feature_bullets: [Cnet's Award] Cnet calls this bluetooth headphone "The Best Headphones for 2020".

[Hi-Fi Stereo Sound] Dual powerful 40mm sound stage drivers deliver true-to-life audio with rich bass that's just like the real thing. Engineered with advanced passive noise reduction, not active noise cancellation (ANC). It could prolong the lifetime of the battery and offers more real sound.

[40H Playtime] Built-in rechargeable battery with a full charge of 4 hours enables your beats go on for a whopping 40 hours playtime. You could also use this bluetooth headphone as a wired headphone with the provided audio cable plugged into your earphone jack so the headphone will never power off.

[Comfortable Design] In order to achieve perfect fit and comfortable wearing experience, the bluetooth headphones were designed with adjustable headband, metallic slider and protein leather the memory-protein cushioned earmuffs. The ergonomic design enables users to work long time without fatigue.

[Excellent Connection & Hands-Free Call] CSR chips and Bluetooth 4.1 technology of this bluetooth headphone provides quick and stable connection with your device. Wireless headphone over ear with a high-quality built-in microphone for hands-free calls.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars3,472 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
